channel.title: Other people can't open my batch file, but I can?
channel.description:
The batch file that I have contains the following code (run.bat):
[code]@echo off Title Client cd ./Class/ START java -Xmx512m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32 exit[/code]
It opens for me, but for other people it either says the system path can not be specified or just closes the second they open it.

item.title: Other people can't open my batch file, but I can?
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

im having the same problem, and have tryed the suggestions post on here and still get no client to load and play on can anyone teamviewer me?

Read full topic

item.title: Other people can't open my batch file, but I can?
item.dc:creator: @Liam_Baby Liam Baby
item.description:
@Liam_Baby wrote:

oldschool-scape:

jup but if u got windows 7 it may be Program Files (x86)

Now it doesn’t even open for me.

The code in the run.bat

@echo off Title Client cd ./Class/ "C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx512m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32 exit

The code in the run windows 7.bat

@echo off Title Client cd ./Class/ "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx512m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32 exit

They both just open for a second and then close

Read full topic

item.title: Other people can't open my batch file, but I can?
item.dc:creator: @Liam_Baby Liam Baby
item.description:
@Liam_Baby wrote:

oldschool-scape:

u also can change tje JDk_6_0_24 shit to jre6, and yes evrybody has it who ever played runescape

So the code should look exactly like this?

@echo off Title Client cd ./Class/ "C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx512m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32 exit

item.title: Other people can't open my batch file, but I can?
item.dc:creator: @Liam_Baby Liam Baby
item.description:
@Liam_Baby wrote:

zyle1992:

Most people (on this site) haven’t set their PATH variable to include the JDK.

If I’m changing it to "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\java.exe" -Xmx512m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32

Do they have to have JDK? Because I’m pretty sure not many people have it, unless they wanna make their own server

Read full topic

item.title: Other people can't open my batch file, but I can?
item.dc:creator: @Liam_Baby Liam Baby
item.description:
@Liam_Baby wrote:

[quote=“oldschool-scape, post:2, topic:423314”]they need to put their java version into the command,

instead of the START java -Xmx512m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32

they have to put their own java like this

Thanks, I’ll go see if it works now I’ll reply back and tell you if it works or not
